jobDescription: Skycatch is looking for an MBA Intern to help the product management team to deliver the best drone data platform to optimize businesses. We build an entire platform spanning: cameras, drones, firmware, cloud software, mobile apps, edge computing, computer vision, and AI, so your opportunities for learning are limitless.  You will support the growth and success of the company by solving our customer's most critical problems and delivering simple software and hardware solutions, quickly and frequently. We are building an entirely new industry with drones, computer vision, and AI, so you need to love exploring the unknown and cutting a new trail. Sound like the time of your life? Come join us at Skycatch! What you'll do:Learn about the industry and conduct research on new market opportunitiesOwn the roadmap, requirements, designs, test plans, and release plan for new features and ongoing improvements for web, cloud and mobile productsUse scrum techniques to get things done faster and betterInterface with customers, sales, and customer success for continuous learning and feedbackWhat we're looking for:Strong technical background; B.S in engineering or computer science with 2-3 years of work experienceMust be pursuing a full-time MBA degree from a top schoolMust be graduating in spring 2019Have the authorization to work in the United StatesDesired Skills:Excellent communication skillsDeep appreciation for brilliant user-centered designMotivated by startups; ability to work in a fast-paced, iterative, innovative environment, managing multiple simultaneous effortsExcellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environmentCover letters are preferred but not required.**We do not sponsor Visa/Work Authorization**More about Skycatch: Skycatch (www.skycatch.com) is a platform for capturing data using small autonomous aerial robots. Our product is built for enterprise with safety, strength, and reliability in mind. It can cover large geographic areas, be equipped with different sensors depending on the customer’s needs, and operate in challenging weather conditions. Our proprietary battery-swapping and autonomous landing technology gives our aerial robots the ability to scale and operate without human involvement.
